P.title: Will Ukraine join NATO before 2030?
P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2030, Ukraine is officially invited to join NATO and the invitation is accepted by the Ukrainian government. The invitation must be documented in an official NATO communiquÃ© or similar authoritative source. Additionally, the acceptance must be confirmed by a public statement from the President of Ukraine or the Ukrainian government. The resolution will also consider the status of Ukraine's membership in NATO if it has completed all necessary reforms and met the criteria for membership as outlined in NATO's Membership Action Plan. Any temporary or conditional invitations that do not lead to full membership by the specified date do not count towards a Yes resolution.

Q_given_P.title: Given Ukraine joins NATO before 2030, will NATO conduct joint military exercises with Ukraine before 2026?
Q_given_P.body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2030, Ukraine is officially invited to join NATO and the invitation is accepted by the Ukrainian government. The invitation must be documented in an official NATO communiqué or similar authoritative source. Additionally, the acceptance must be confirmed by a public statement from the President of Ukraine or the Ukrainian government. The resolution will also consider the status of Ukraine's membership in NATO if it has completed all necessary reforms and met the criteria for membership as outlined in NATO's Membership Action Plan. Any temporary or conditional invitations that do not lead to full membership by the specified date do not count towards a Yes resolution. 

If Ukraine joins NATO before 2030, then this question will resolve as Yes if NATO conducts joint military exercises with Ukraine before January 1, 2026. A joint military exercise is defined as any coordinated military training operation involving personnel from both NATO member states and Ukraine that is officially announced and takes place on Ukrainian territory or in international waters involving Ukrainian forces. The exercise must be publicly confirmed by NATO or the Ukrainian government through an official statement or reputable news sources (e.g., BBC, The Guardian, Reuters, New York Times, Washington Post). Any exercises that are part of a larger multinational operation or that do not include Ukrainian forces do not count towards this resolution.

Any temporary or conditional invitations that do not lead to full membership by the specified date do not count towards a Yes resolution. (2) NATO conducts joint military exercises with Ukraine before January 1, 2026, which are defined as coordinated military training operations involving personnel from both NATO member states and Ukraine, officially announced and taking place on Ukrainian territory or in international waters involving Ukrainian forces, and publicly confirmed by NATO or the Ukrainian government. 

Then, will any NATO member state oppose Ukraine's membership before 2030? This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2030, any NATO member state officially declares its opposition to Ukraine's membership in NATO. This opposition must be made through a formal statement by a government official or through an official communication from the NATO organization. The statement must explicitly mention opposition to Ukraine's membership and cannot be vague or ambiguous. Statements made in informal settings, such as interviews or social media, do not count unless they are later confirmed through official channels. In case of multiple statements, the first official declaration of opposition will determine the resolution.

P.title: Will the US House of Representatives pass significant legislation regarding nuclear safety standards by 2025?
P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, the US House of Representatives has passed legislation that significantly alters nuclear safety standards. Q_given_P.body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2032, at least two new soccer markets are officially recognized as having professional leagues or significant national representation in international soccer tournaments as a direct result of the FIFA World Cup's expansion to 48 teams. A 'new soccer market' is defined as a country or region that has not previously had a significant presence in international soccer competitions, specifically those that have not qualified for a World Cup or continental championship in the last 20 years. The recognition must come from FIFA or a reputable soccer governing body, and the new markets must demonstrate a sustainable soccer infrastructure, including a professional league and national team participation in FIFA-sanctioned tournaments. Reports from credible sources such as FIFA, BBC, The Guardian, or similar outlets will be accepted as evidence. 

Resolution criteria for the condition: This question resolves as Yes if there is clear evidence of a significant increase in global soccer viewership attributed to the FIFA World Cup's expansion to 48 teams, specifically: 1. An increase of at least 20% in the average global viewership numbers for the World Cup compared to the previous tournament with 32 teams in 2018. 2. Official reports from FIFA or credible third-party sources confirming this increase. 3. The increase must be directly linked to the expanded format.
